tweets.text: Oh wonderful. It's my day off tomorrow so I was going to try & get some PhD work done, but I'm met with the familiar smell of hydrogen sulphide entering my home from Walleys Quarry. Looks like it'll be yet another sleepless night for our community, full of noxious gases & odours.

Breaking News . @EnvAgency have sanctioned the destruction of breeding birds tomorrow at the Lower Otter Restoration Project . This is #HS2 part 2 . PLEASE THINK AGAIN @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest Please follow @WiseBirding and RT https://t.co/I8Wv40YKqy

urls.title: Three fined in oven cleaner hazardous waste case - Watery-News
urls.description: The final stage of a prosecution brought by the Environment Agency, over illegal management of hazardous waste, has seen three companies fined a total of ¬£354,000. Working with Rochdale borough council, the Agency action saw three firms fined this month: Chemclear UK Ltd of Rowton, Warrington; and Chemtech Waste Management Ltd and Envirosol Ltd of the Environmental Resource Group of Brownhills,

tweets.text: @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency Don't forget their other company also headed by crimey Mr Share, Chem Tech Waste Management - take the award for repackaging oven cleaner which a child subsequently drank - clear the floor for environmental horror that is Red https://t.co/sdF9F320kq

We can now see it‚Äôs not the @EnvAgency being scared of an orphaned site , they‚Äôre scared of footing the bill to restore it . It‚Äôs a case of The EA with no money , red with no interest and us in the middle with no quality of life . @StinkStopthe

urls.title: Childhood air pollution exposure linked to poor mental health - Air Quality News
urls.description: Exposure to air pollution in childhood and adolescence is linked to an increased risk of mental illness from the age...

tweets.text:
Exposure to air pollution in childhood and adolescence is linked to an increased risk of mental illness from the age of 18, according to a new multidecade study published in the journal JAMA Open Network. 
https://t.co/YZiJZqdSzy

urls.title: Researchers explore connection between air pollution and mental health ‚Äì AirQualityNews
urls.description: Researchers at Queen Mary University London have been awarded 300,000 to study the impact that air pollution is having on the mental health of children. The study will run over a three year period and will explore whether a reduction in traffic and better air quality improves how well children‚Äôs brains develop, they will then relate these changes to mental health. Children from 85 primary schools are taking part in the study, including schools from Luton and London boroughs of Hackney, Tower Hamlets,
